titleStmt.title: A collection of several passages concerning his late highnesse Oliver, Cromwell, in the time of his sickness; wherein is related many of his expressions upon his death-bed. Together with his prayer within two or three dayes before his death. Written by one that was then groom of his bed-chamber.
titleStmt.author: Walker, Henry, Ironmonger.

titleStmt.title: A collection of several passages concerning his late highnesse Oliver, Cromwell, in the time of his sickness; wherein is related many of his expressions upon his death-bed. Together with his prayer within two or three dayes before his death. Written by one that was then groom of his bed-chamber.
titleStmt.author: Walker, Henry, Ironmonger.
Harvey, Charles, 17th cent, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Robert Ibbitson, dwelling in Smithfield, neer Hosier-Lane end,

notesStmt.note: One that was then groom of his bed-chamber = Henry Walker. Also sometimes attributed to Charles Harvey.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
